question.title: How do I specify the parameters correctly in BitmapFont?
question.body:
I'm creating text for my game using the LibGDX engine. I found the easiest way through BitmapFont, and here's the first implementation that works but is very blurry:

private BitmapFont font;
// Begin create
font = new BitmapFont();
// End create
// Begin Draw
spriteBatch.begin();
        font.getData().setScale(1.5f);
        font.setColor(Color.WHITE);
        font.draw(spriteBatch, Integer.toString(duck.duck_score), camera.position.x-200,camera.position.y+130);
        font.draw(spriteBatch, "E to Dash!", 510, 380);
        font.draw(spriteBatch, Integer.toString(duck.dash_time), camera.position.x + 204,camera.position.y + 130);
        spriteBatch.end();
// End Draw

But as I said, the picture is blurry, so I changed one line by adding a font:

font = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal("ComicsFont.ttf"), false);

Here's a takeaway from the library, and it seems like it should work:

public BitmapFont (FileHandle fontFile, boolean flip) {
         this(new BitmapFontData(fontFile, flip), (TextureRegion)null, true);
}

As a result, exit value 1. Here is a link to the full code repository: https://github.com/Logorigm/platform I'm new to development, so I'd appreciate any help you can provide.

I tried changing the font file and adding parameters, but I couldn't find a solution.

answers.body:
BitmapFont is a font pre-rendered as images, so depending on the size of the image compared to the size you are drawing it as it can come off as blurry or pixelated.

You can use the FreeTypeFontGenerator to generate a BitmapFont from a .ttf file, that will give you opportunity to size the font according to some metric of your game (for example a percentage of your screen size or something like that).

A simple way of achieving this would be to have a method something like this:

private static BitmapFont buildFont(FileHandle fontFile, float size, Color shadowColor, String characters) {
    var generator = new FreeTypeFontGenerator(fontFile);
    var parameter = new FreeTypeFontGenerator.FreeTypeFontParameter();
    parameter.size = (int)size;

    // Set whatever style of font you want
    parameter.shadowColor = shadowColor;
    parameter.shadowOffsetX = 2;
    parameter.shadowOffsetY = 2;
    parameter.characters = characters;
    parameter.kerning = true;
    parameter.gamma = 1.0f;
    parameter.magFilter = Texture.TextureFilter.Nearest;
    parameter.minFilter = Texture.TextureFilter.Nearest;
    
    // Or filter like this for non pixelated text
    /*
    parameter.magFilter = Texture.TextureFilter.Linear;
    parameter.minFilter = Texture.TextureFilter.Linear;
    */

    var font = generator.generateFont(parameter);
    font.getData().markupEnabled = true;

    generator.dispose();
    return font;
}

Which you could call to get your aptly sized BitmapFont:

var charSet = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYUZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789:!?.";
var fontFile = Gdx.files.internal("ComicsFont.ttf");
BitmapFont largeFont = buildFont(fontFile, (float)Gdx.graphics.getWidth() * 0.2f, Color.BLACK, charSet);
BitmapFont smallFont = buildFont(fontFile, (float)Gdx.graphics.getWidth() * 0.05f, Color.BLACK, charSet);
